While Cesium is a powerful tool for building 3D visualization and mapping applications, there are several other technologies and frameworks that could be used to build a platform like Worlds iVue. Here are a few alternatives:

1. Unity: Unity is a powerful game engine that can also be used for building augmented reality and drone applications. With Unity, you can build 3D environments and simulations, add interactive objects and effects, and integrate with drones and other hardware. Unity provides many plugins and assets for AR and drone applications, making it a good alternative to Cesium.
2. Mapbox: Mapbox is a mapping platform that provides tools for building custom maps and visualizations. It has a powerful JavaScript API that can be used to add 3D features to maps, such as extrusions and overlays. Mapbox also has an augmented reality SDK that can be used to build AR applications.
3. OpenLayers: OpenLayers is an open-source JavaScript library for building web mapping applications. It provides a robust set of features for working with map data, including 3D capabilities using WebGL. OpenLayers is highly customizable and can be used to build a variety of mapping and visualization applications.
4. Three.js: Three.js is a JavaScript library that provides tools for building 3D graphics and animations in the browser. It can be used to create interactive 3D models and environments, and provides tools for adding textures, lighting, and other effects. While Three.js does not provide built-in mapping capabilities, it can be used in conjunction with other mapping libraries to add 3D features to maps.

These alternatives each have their own strengths and weaknesses, and the choice of which to use will depend on the specific requirements and goals of the project.
